title: NAACP
summary: The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP)[lower-alpha 1] is a civil rights organization in the United States, formed in 1909 as an interracial endeavor to advance justice for African Americans by a group including W. E. B. Du Bois, Mary White Ovington, Moorfield Storey and Ida B. Wells.[3][4]
